item.title: Overly bearish investors risk writing off 2025 too soon. These strategies offer upside and downside protection.
item.description: Ed Yardeni argues that, to match the doom and gloom from Wall Street bears, the stock market would need to see a Lehman-esque meltdown.

item.title: ‘She’s kept him afloat’: I’m 78 and leaving my daughter my life savings, but her partner is unemployed and doesn’t pay rent. What do I do?
item.description: “He keeps losing jobs and going on unemployment.”

item.title: Tesla earnings could offer hope for the stock. But this has to happen first.
item.description: The EV company’s investors want reassurance on sales and future projects such as robotaxis and a cheaper vehicle.

item.title: My IRA and personal trading account had the biggest one-day gain ever. What will tomorrow bring?
item.description: “My personal trading account was also up 18% in one day.”

item.title: I begged my adviser to sell amid the market turmoil. He dragged his feet and I lost $20,000. Do I have any recourse?
item.description: “If he had moved my money out of the market weeks ago, much of my loss could have been prevented.”
